original_content:
If you are a certain age or just like retrocomputers, you probably have a soft spot for good old-fashioned BASIC. If you miss those days but dont want to install a modern interpreter, you dont have to. Just load a web page containing the BASIC Anywhere Machine from [CJ Veniot]. Worried about it being in the cloud? It isnt? It runs in your browser, and if you are a TiddlyWiki fan, it will even live inside your Wiki, which you can host as you please.
The project has lots of features, including some integration back into TiddlyWiki, which we havent tried. But you can use graphics commands, work with the mouse, and do other fun things.

The only peculiarity is that the program pops up in a window that resembles an old Commodore 64 screen. Depending on why you want to use this, that could be an advantage or a disadvantage. You can see a nice plot running from a TiddlyWiki topic in the title image. Heres the Tiddler:
The code behind the wave
The BASIC Anywhere Machine is highly modified from Googles wwwBASIC, which is fun, too. Since weve covered TiddlyWiki before, we are a little ashamed we didnt think to marry those two codebases ourselves!
title: クラウド上ではなくオフラインで使える、古風なBASICエミュレータ
body: ハードウェア・ソフトウェアの知識を持つ人に向け、グラフィックスやマウス操作などもできる「BASIC Anywhere Machine」をウェブ上で利用できる。TiddlyWikiとの統合も可能。ただし、古いコモドール64の画面で動作するため好みが分かれる。

TiddlyWikiとの統合も可能な、ブラウザ上で動作するBASICマシン
グラフィックスやマウス操作も可能な、レトロコンピュータ風のBASICプログラミング環境
GoogleのwwwBASICをベースにした楽しいエミュレータ
TiddlyWikiと組み合わせれば、自分のウェブホスティング環境で利用できるBASICマシン
